Name: Anis-thetic
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Giffard Menthe Pastille white crème de menthe
5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
3 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
7.5 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: SHAKE all ingredients and fine strain into an empty chilled glass.
Review: As the name suggests, this bourbon-based drink is fresh breath-tastic.
History: Adapted from a drink created in 2009 by Danny Murphy at the Met Bar, London, England. Originally made with homemade anis syrup and without crème de menthe.
Garnish: Mint sprig & absinthe mist from atomiser
